examples: Your wish is my command sire.
Her wish was my command
I wouldn't wish that professor on my worst enemy.
I wished him well with his new venture.
Don't you wish!
words.defineEn: to desire something to occur or to be true even though it is improbable or not possible
words.defineVi: để mong muốn một cái gì đó xảy ra hoặc là sự thật mặc dù nó là không thể hoặc không thể

examples: He made a false claim about his achievements to impress others.
She reached a high score on the exam and was proud of her achievement.
Being the Benjamin of the family, Sarah is constantly compared to her older siblings and their achievements.
Although they struggled to make ends meet, the Johnsons took pride in their children's academic achievements and aspirations.
Villa have punched above their weight all season and it will be a remarkable achievement if they finish fifth.
words.defineEn: the process or act of achieving something
words.defineVi: quá trình hoặc hành động để đạt được một cái gì đó

examples: Our aim is to protect the jobs of our members.
The talks are aimed at ending the conflict.
The program aims to set convicts on their feet after they've been released from prison.
This charity aims to help people to help themselves.
The college's aim is to help students achieve their aspirations.
words.defineEn: something that is desired; the purpose or reason of doing something
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó được mong muốn; mục đích hoặc lý do làm một cái gì đó

examples: Our aim is to protect the jobs of our members.
The talks are aimed at ending the conflict.
The program aims to set convicts on their feet after they've been released from prison.
This charity aims to help people to help themselves.
The college's aim is to help students achieve their aspirations.
words.defineEn: to intend or attempt to achieve something
words.defineVi: để có ý định hoặc cố gắng để đạt được một cái gì đó

examples: She realized the truth in the saying 'a person with too much ambition cannot sleep in peace.'
The politician maintained a pleasant facade but his opponents knew that cats hide their claws, so they remained wary of his true motives and ambitions.
I had so many ambitions when I first graduated from college, but now I feel like I'm in a rut.
Her consuming ambition to become a doctor led her to work tirelessly and sacrifice many other interests in her life.
Despite their ambition and hard work, the small business owners realized that a stream cannot rise above its source, and decided to seek outside help to expand their business.
words.defineEn: the will to be wealthy, powerful, successful, etc.
words.defineVi: ý muốn giàu có, quyền lực, thành công, v.v.

examples: "That boy isn't very bright."
These shrubs produce bright red berries.
The bird had bright feathers and a long beak.
Some bright spark left the tap running all night.
I arrived bright and early at Brian the falconer's house for day one of my course.
words.defineEn: (of someone or something's future) likely to be successful and very good
words.defineVi: (về tương lai của ai đó hoặc cái gì đó) có khả năng thành công và rất tốt

examples: This policy is no longer an effective means to an end.
Identifying a specific segment of the market as our target will be more effective than a shotgun approach.
Researchers found this to be the most effective method.
A new study is casting doubt on the once popular narrative that N95 masks are more effective than surgical masks.
The research appears to show that the drug is effective in most cases.
words.defineEn: achieving the intended or desired result
words.defineVi: đạt được kết quả dự định hoặc mong muốn

examples: Efforts to stop the spread of the disease.
Our efforts are finally paying dividends.
The effort killed him.
Efforts at reform seem to come in fits and starts.
Efforts were made to check the disease.
words.defineEn: an attempt to do something, particularly something demanding
words.defineVi: một nỗ lực để làm một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là một cái gì đó đòi hỏi

examples: Your wish is my command sire.
Her wish was my command
I wouldn't wish that professor on my worst enemy.
I wished him well with his new venture.
Don't you wish!
words.defineEn: a feeling of desire for something or of wanting something to happen
words.defineVi: một cảm giác mong muốn cho một cái gì đó hoặc muốn một cái gì đó xảy ra

examples: I could manage that.
We managed to raise him on his mobile phone.
We managed to lose our pursuers in the darkness.
I managed to find a solution to the problem.
The company managed to beat the clock on delivering its new system.
words.defineEn: to do something successfully, particularly something difficult
words.defineVi: để làm một cái gì đó thành công, đặc biệt là một cái gì đó khó khăn

examples: Equip yourself with five practical strategies that help you win the uphill battle and take your project professional career to new heights.
Her husband is a man of ideas while she is a practical doctor, a woman of action.
You need to have a practical plan in place to ensure your success.
That experience made me open my eyes and started my search for a martial art that teaches practical self-defence skills.
Mark was thinking about buying a new car, but he wanted to get a second opinion, so he took his dad's advice and went for a more practical model.
words.defineEn: (of a method, idea, or plan) likely to be successful or effective
words.defineVi: (của một phương pháp, ý tưởng hoặc kế hoạch) có khả năng thành công hoặc hiệu quả

examples: She left a positive review online for the restaurant where she ordered a pizza.
If you invest time and energy into learning and personal growth, you will see positive results in your life.
Melissa's new book got off to a flying start, with high sales and positive reviews from readers and critics alike.
Consuming prunes may have a positive impact on heart health by reducing LDL cholesterol levels.
Sticks and stones may break my bones, but my positive attitude will never falter.
words.defineEn: having a successful result or tending toward improvement and progress
words.defineVi: có kết quả thành công hoặc có xu hướng cải thiện và tiến bộ

examples: She received false advice that led to negative consequences.
I don't want to dwell on the negative aspects of our situation.
The right hand doesn't know what the left is doing, and the result is setting customers up for a negative experience.
Buying time may serve as a buffer against the negative effects of time stress in part by enhancing perceived control.
Criticizing the government for not doing enough to control the economy cuts both ways, as too much government intervention can also lead to negative consequences.
words.defineEn: having an unpleasant or harmful effect on someone or something; not having a positive effect
words.defineVi: có ảnh hưởng khó chịu hoặc có hại cho ai đó hoặc cái gì đó; không có tác dụng tích cực

examples: We won’t be promoting Larry.
She teaches yoga to promote health and well-being.
The organization is committed to promoting equality and fairness for every person.
Anna was promoted to manager last year, and she's been in the fast lane ever since.
Earth Day is observed on April 22nd to promote environmental awareness.
words.defineEn: to help or support the progress or development of something
words.defineVi: để giúp đỡ hoặc hỗ trợ sự tiến bộ hoặc phát triển của một cái gì đó

examples: They showed their parents no respect.
I respect your opinion, but I'm for the other candidate.
Kramer has certainly won the respect of his peers.
No one will respect those who bows and scrapes every day.
Mary's kindness and generosity towards others has earned her love and respect from everyone she meets.
words.defineEn: admiration for someone or something because of their achievements, qualities, etc.
words.defineVi: sự ngưỡng mộ đối với ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó vì thành tích, phẩm chất của họ, v.v.

examples: They showed their parents no respect.
I respect your opinion, but I'm for the other candidate.
Kramer has certainly won the respect of his peers.
No one will respect those who bows and scrapes every day.
Mary's kindness and generosity towards others has earned her love and respect from everyone she meets.
words.defineEn: to admire someone or something because of their achievements, qualities, etc.
words.defineVi: để ngưỡng mộ ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó vì thành tích, phẩm chất của họ, v.v.

examples: He continued his work in secret.
Grandma's secret stuffing recipe includes a combination of diced onions, celery, and fragrant herbs.
Their affair was an open secret in army circles.
My student had a secret but my lips were sealed.
The chef used a secret blend of herbs and spices as the seasoning for the famous fried chicken.
words.defineEn: a way of achieving something that is the best or the only way of doing so
words.defineVi: một cách để đạt được một cái gì đó là tốt nhất hoặc cách duy nhất để làm như vậy

examples: Parents often support their children financially during college.
The organization supports various charitable causes through donations.
This support has dramatically tilted the balance of power in favor of the Algerian ruling elite.
The government makes a big thing out of public support.
Support the possibility of keeping a lid on tax increases.
words.defineEn: to provide someone or something with encouragement or help
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó với sự khuyến khích hoặc giúp đỡ

words.defineEn: to achieve or improve something by trying very hard for it
words.defineVi: để đạt được hoặc cải thiện một cái gì đó bằng cách cố gắng hết sức cho nó

examples: Sleep well and sweet dreams.
The wedding celebrations went like a dream.
Many actors dream of winning prestigious awards for their performances.
A few weeks later, I landed my dream job.
Our dream destination for this year's vacation is a secluded tropical island.
words.defineEn: to think about something that one desires very much
words.defineVi: để suy nghĩ về một cái gì đó mà một người mong muốn rất nhiều

examples: The party has broken ranks, with five of its nine presidential hopefuls calling for a review of the revisions.
The manager keeps changing his outlook on the project, now really hopeful, now very pessimistic.
Others were hopeful, medical, reflective. -
At this vaccine center in Mumbai, hopeful recipients were turned away.
I'm very hopeful.
words.defineEn: (of a person) believing in the occurrence of what is wanted
words.defineVi: (của một người) tin vào sự xuất hiện của những gì được mong muốn

examples: Journalists on the spot reported no progress.
Fallen rock is impeding the progress of rescue workers.
Our progress has been fairly slow so far, but it's early days.
He made such quick progress that the others suspected him of having private lessons on the sly.
The parents attended the school meeting to discuss their child's progress.
words.defineEn: movement toward an improved or more developed state
words.defineVi: hướng tới một trạng thái được cải thiện hoặc phát triển hơn

examples: The government intends, by hook or by crook, to hold on to the land.
The gentlemen's agreement was never intended to apply to executive functions.
These changes are intended to put a lid on rising medical costs.
I intend to remain faithful, simply because I've given infidelity a whirl and it doesn't work for me.
She took it in the spirit in which it was intended.
words.defineEn: to have something in mind as a plan or purpose
words.defineVi: để có một cái gì đó trong tâm trí như một kế hoạch hoặc mục đích

examples: The Siemens display goes the whole hog.
The cruise went very quickly.
My laptop went haywire
To go swimming/fishing/jogging.
The email went to everyone in the company.
words.defineEn: to progress in a particular way
words.defineVi: để tiến bộ trong một cách cụ thể

examples: He rarely fought his political battles in the open.
Fighting like cats and dogs like always.
The children had pillow fights during their sleepover.
He has always fought the good fight against oppression.
A young cyclist is fighting for his life after the accident.
words.defineEn: will and energy to keep trying to achieve, prevent, or stop something
words.defineVi: ý chí và năng lượng để tiếp tục cố gắng đạt được, ngăn chặn hoặc ngăn chặn điều gì đó

examples: Fortunately it's not doom and gloom for all businesses, in spite of the economic situation.
I was nervous when I had to tell him that he was wrong, but fortunately he took it in good part and we stayed friends.
Fortunately Manfred arrived just in time and talked some sense into her.
You marching here alone only proves that you're having death wish, but fortunately it is something that I can help you with.
Fortunately, on Earth, the ozone layer blocks gamma rays.
words.defineEn: to express that something good happened or something bad did not happen because of good luck
words.defineVi: để diễn đạt rằng một cái gì đó tốt đã xảy ra hoặc một cái gì đó xấu đã không xảy ra vì may mắn

examples: Unfortunately, experience is the teacher of fools.
Unfortunately, the price of short ribs can be quite high.
Unfortunately, the president struck the wrong note in his speech, ignoring the public mood.
Unfortunately, most companies won't take a long look in the mirror until something goes disastrously wrong.
Unfortunately, I had to give the party a pass because I had a migraine last night.
words.defineEn: used to express regret or say that something is disappointing or sad
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện sự hối tiếc hoặc nói rằng một cái gì đó là thất vọng hoặc buồn

examples: The entrepreneur's friends in high places helped her secure funding for her startup and launch it successfully.
Despite the challenges, they stood fast and successfully completed the project.
The cleaning service offered to remove the stubborn stain from the carpet on a 'no cure no pay' basis, meaning that the homeowner would only pay if the stain was successfully removed.
Sarah knew that in order to accomplish their project successfully, she needed to play ball with her team members and actively listen to their ideas and suggestions.
Potter successfully germinated mushroom spores in her home.
words.defineEn: in a manner that achieves what is desired or expected
words.defineVi: theo cách đạt được những gì mong muốn hoặc mong đợi

examples: We need the results now.
She'll have had the results by now.
The result of this election is going to be too close to call.
The bakery incorporated finely diced fatback into savory pie crusts for flaky results.
If you invest time and energy into learning and personal growth, you will see positive results in your life.
words.defineEn: to directly cause something
words.defineVi: để trực tiếp gây ra một cái gì đó

examples: The apartment has a secure entry system.
A win today secures our spot in the championship, so go out there and give 110%!
She keeps her passport in a secure place at home.
A secure background will help a child to grow emotionally.
The entrepreneur's friends in high places helped her secure funding for her startup and launch it successfully.
words.defineEn: to achieve something, especially with difficulty
words.defineVi: để đạt được một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là với khó khăn
